185966567.review:
After stacking up over a million Badass Points on the PS3 a decade ago I still turned around and bought this gem on Steam. I've played this game for more hours than any self respecting person would admit to, and I'll still be pouring more hours into it on PC because it's just That Fucking Good.

The Borderlands series is such a magnificently unserious spoof of open world shooters and RPGs that are under the impression their parade of hackneyed tropes piling out of the clown car of billion dollar mediocrity factories are the classic works of tomorrow. Handsome Jack seemed like a stroke of comic genius at the time of initial release, and both sadly and amusingly serves as a dark prophecy of the masturbatory jackasses failing upwards to our collective bane today. Brash? Arrogant? Stunningly un-self-aware? 

No, I mean Jack, I don't know who you thought I might be referencing there. I suppose you should interrogate such knee jerk assumptions to find the roots deep within the fissures of your own fragile ego. We're talking about a cartoon villain with a plastic face stapled on his nauseatingly mutilated face...how could you assume there might be some contemporary parallel that renews Jack's relevance with each passing headline?

How did we all get so jaded to the clownish antics of...uh...Handsome Jack? Damned if I know, I'm some dude writing an untimely review of a game you should already have bought.

185945908.review:
Remember when this franchise used to be good? I sure do.

Although this game feels more buggy now than it did ages ago (dunno if that's due to newer architectures or updates made to the game) it still feels like the game I always knew and loved. This and 1 are easily the go-to titles for this franchise, although Pre-Sequel isn't bad either. The gameplay is solid, the story is actually very well done (albeit with a pretty big plot hole still involved) for a Borderlands title, and it really makes me wish that the subsequent releases in the franchise actually even bothered to try to live up to the quality this game provided. Who knows how far this franchise could've gone if that were the case. Thanks, Randy.

Also this series peaked with Handsome Jack. They haven't written a better character since. Fight me.

i wtej części znowu musimy wybrać z czwórki(lub 6 jak masz dlc)
która znowu każda się specjalizuje w innej zdolności i stylu grania, są jeszcze bardziej wyraziste)
System strzlania bardzo się zmienił od poprzedniczki jak chodzi działanie gnatów i tu twócy naprawdę wyrazili się kreatywnością co do niektórych a także dodali badass rangi za robienie w ciągu gry mikro wyzwań zdobywasz punkty które losow dają 0,25% do danej cechy.
Bossowie jak mam porównać żle nie jest powiedziałbym jeden kij, bardziej bym pochwalił mini bossów większa wyrazistość jak stylu walki i jak wyglądu.
Główny zły no icona wszystkich złodupców jacy wyszli do 2024(a zarazem przez przypadek wielka farma pieniędzy dla studia przez dobre kolejne 6lat).
W porównaniu do poprzedniczki jest dość gigantyczna różnorodność biomów.
I nowa rzecz możliwość castomizacji głównych postaci wyglądowo jak i samochodów(co nie którzy się zesrają była no ta 6 kolorów do wyboru jak do bohatera i samochodu i nara).
Największe bolączki mimo że jest więcej fajnych pobocznych questów gdzie możesz się usmiechnąć to jest znacznie więcej typu zabij przynieś i odbierz questa.
dodano wybory w 99% ograniczają się do nagrody jeden choć nic nie wnosi w grę to może dać graczowi satyfakcje.
Och te Dlc i znowu tu dali mistrzowskie dlc(jak tiny tina's assault on dragon keep) a reszta do wyrzucenia.
Ten tytuł to jest najlepszy test jak chodzi o ten typ lootershootera jeśli się nie bawiłeś przez pierwsze 2h niecałe to se odpóść całą serie.
P.S.
tu znowu polecam tylko podstawkę tylko z tym jednym dlc jak siadła zabawa mając w głowie że dwójka jest dwa razy dłuższa do przejścia niż jedynka.

185475706.review: I've put a good amount of time in this game so I thought it was the right time to put a honest review out there. Borderlands is known to be a looter/shooter and doesn't disappoint with that, there is plenty of unique and different weapons that will keep you entertained since loot is easily available just about anywhere, mission rewards, random drops from any enemies and bosses to the many chest spread across the land or even vending machines. The vault hunters are the most fun and appealing they've had in the whole series, each vault hunter has there own ultimate and builds that really stand out from one another. I like the visuals, has that iconic borderlands cartoonish look to it but is pleasing to look at. There is plenty of areas to explore but not like an open world adventure size, they make the maps feel bigger than what they really are but are still visually appealing. There is a wide array of enemies like psychos, large insects, dragons, robots and much more that keeps the game intriguing. The story is not for everyone, it's mainly toilet humor while also having some serious moments. Now that I've talked about the main parts of the game, it's time to talk about the actual gameplay itself since this game can be a grind or it can be a casual laid back game depending on how invested you're into it and if you're playing solo. There's a level cap followed with something called OP levels (there's 10) which increases the difficulty of the game and gives better loot each level you go up. You can draw the line at the level cap and not worry about the op levels. If you do go trough the OP levels you will have to do some farming, farming is big in borderlands. Farming is when you try to get a specific type of weapon, shield, grenade, etc. from an enemy or mission and repeatedly kill that enemy or turn that mission in till you get that said item. Some people may find it enjoyable to do, other's might find it repetitive or boring but it is completely up to the player. This should  some up the basics for people new the series. Some last thoughts before I wrap this up, I still enjoy the game to this day, not only the game itself and all the content it has to offer but there's still hidden features i'm still discovering like new character builds, easter eggs, game breaking glitches, it just makes the game more enjoyable and interesting the more I find. Anyhow thankyou for reading if you made it this far and hopefully this helps some people out.

I have 174 hours in this game and it has had very few good, happy times. I have rage quit this game many times and end up coming back after using the stupid shift codes for better than average weapons. The biggest problem I have is the weapons are so under powered. There is 1000 different types and 98% are trash. When i use the golden keys for better guns I have to use 20-30 tries at a time because there are too many trash items. The monsters are too OP and run in packs that overwhelm. When battling i spend most of the time shooting and then running for my life. Repeat over and over until i whittle them down, or die. Hyperion takes 9% of your cash to respawn you. When you die the boss resets as expected. So on top of losing all the ammo and grenades from the fight, you lose 9% of your cash. My last battle i lost just over 2.5 million dollars from penalty and repleneshing RPG's,grenades, and ammo. Since monsters are OP and weapons are so week you have to throw thousands of rounds down range for a few kills. Now i know why players are adding Mods to their characters to overcome the games out of balance gameplay.
 So back to the Golden keys for better random loot, It might help you get through some weeker battles, but as the game scales with your level, you will find you weapon becomes useless after you level 2-3 times and then back to the golden chest again to be competative again. I hope Borderlands 4 fixes the imbalance.

185309760.review:
🎮 Le maître incontesté des shooters-looters

Borderlands 2 est, pour moi, le meilleur jeu de sa catégorie et un pilier du genre shooter-looter.

✅ Ce qui le rend exceptionnel :

Un univers unique : L'humour noir, les personnages mémorables, et l'ambiance déjantée font de ce jeu une expérience inoubliable.

Gameplay addictif : La chasse au loot est incroyablement bien pensée, avec une variété d'armes et de mods qui poussent à toujours vouloir découvrir ce qui se cache derrière le prochain coffre.

Histoire captivante : Avec Handsome Jack, probablement le meilleur antagoniste tous jeux confondus, le scénario est à la fois surprenant, drôle, et parfois touchant. Les dialogues et la narration sont un modèle du genre.

Des DLC exceptionnels : Chaque extension est une aventure en soi, avec des récits uniques, des personnages mémorables, et des heures de contenu supplémentaire qui enrichissent l'univers du jeu.

Durée de vie faramineuse : Avec sa campagne principale, ses innombrables quêtes secondaires, et ses DLC, Borderlands 2 offre des centaines d'heures de jeu sans jamais lasser.

Coop au top : Jouer avec des amis décuple le fun grâce à une synergie des classes bien équilibrée et une progression commune fluide.

Direction artistique incroyable : Le style cel-shading reste intemporel et donne une identité visuelle unique au jeu.

💭 En résumé :
Borderlands 2 n'est pas juste un excellent jeu, c'est une référence du genre qui a défini les bases du shooter-looter dans l'industrie. Avec son contenu monumental, ses DLC remarquables et Handsome Jack en icône inoubliable, c'est une expérience incontournable pour tous les amateurs d'action et de loot.

Not sure why its taken me so many years to write a review. 

This is my most played game on steam, and probably of all time. 

Game-Play may be a little stiff these days. But is still thoroughly engaging. 
Each character is fun to play (though I mainly play as Siren). 
The Gunzerker being the cream when you want to go charging through the game.

But its the story and the additional content that has had me playing this for many years over and over again. 

The pacing slows in a couple of places, but overall the story is great, the villain perfect. 
The side characters funny, unique and engaging. The Side-Quest are varied. 

Then the DLC's, while not all perfect, are great additions with lots more content and unique items/weapons.

I never knew the appeal of Farming before playing this game.  

I use some mods now to freshen it up a little. 
But vanilla it still a perfect game. 

Very easy to recommend. Its truly Lightning in a bottle.

185228643.review:
Borderlands 2 Review: "Guns, Loot, and Glitches for Days"

Playing Borderlands 2 is like diving into a chaotic carnival of mayhem, humor, and loot—and occasionally falling through the floor because the map forgot to exist.

The gun variety is insane. Want a shotgun that shoots rockets? Sure. A sniper that screams insults? Why not? The story is top-tier, with Handsome Jack stealing the show as one of the best villains ever.

But let’s be real—this game isn’t perfect. You’ve probably experienced a bug or two (or twenty). Got stuck in terrain? Check. Enemies glitching into immortality? Classic. But honestly, the chaos just adds to the charm.

Despite the quirks, Borderlands 2 is a masterpiece of co-op fun, loot grinding, and sarcastic robots.

9/10—would glitch through a wall chasing loot again.

185100645.review:
以下是对《无主之地2》的游戏评价：
 
优点
 
- 游戏玩法：将FPS与RPG元素深度融合，玩家可通过完成任务、打怪升级，提升角色等级并进行技能树加点，还能获得坏小子点数来增强自身能力，不同职业各具特色玩法，为玩家提供了丰富的游戏体验。
- 武器系统：拥有庞大的武器库，上千万把独特枪械，不同武器在配件、属性、词条等方面存在差异，构成无数种枪支组合，让玩家在收集和尝试不同武器的过程中充满乐趣，并且武器的量化系统完善，更具逻辑性和可玩性。
- 剧情与任务：主线剧情完整且引人入胜，反派角色特点鲜明，支线任务丰富多样，大多会给予玩家经验值、武器道具等奖励，同时各DLC剧情风格各异，还会有专属颜色武器等，为游戏增添了更多的内容和乐趣。
- 画面与风格：采用美式卡通风格，色彩偏暗色调，感官舒适，与无厘头搞怪风格相搭配，构建出独特的游戏世界，充满了痞子气质的NPC和各种奇装异服的角色，以及荒蛮十足的潘多拉星球等场景，给玩家带来美漫版《疯狂的麦克斯》的既视感。
- 打击感与音效：各种枪械和技能的射击感爽快，音效配合出色，能让玩家在战斗中感受到强烈的冲击和快感，完美诠释了爆炸艺术的魅力，漫天飞舞的火炮与弹药让人热血沸腾。
 
缺点
 
- 数值平衡：三周目难度过高，武器和装备的数值膨胀严重，导致一二周目能轻松秒杀敌人的装备在三周目基本只能给敌人挠痒痒，对玩家的装备和操作要求过高，平衡性欠佳。
- 语言问题：游戏没有官方中文，繁体中文机翻严重，影响玩家对剧情和武器装备词条的理解，降低了游戏的剧情体验

184886898.review:
"Borderlands 2: Guns, Giggles, and Glorious Mayhem"
Welcome to Borderlands 2, the game where the loot never stops, the jokes hit harder than a Torgue rocket launcher, and you’ll question why a sarcastic robot named Claptrap exists (but secretly love him anyway). Whether you’re new to Pandora or a returning Vault Hunter, this game is the ultimate playground for chaos, comedy, and collecting way too many guns.

Gameplay: Chaos, Combat, and Customization
At its heart, Borderlands 2 is a looter-shooter, but it’s so much more than that. The combat is fast, chaotic, and endlessly entertaining. Whether you’re mowing down enemies with rocket launchers, zapping them with elemental weapons, or throwing grenades that explode into child grenades (thanks, Tediore!), every fight feels unique.

The loot system is one of the best in gaming, featuring over 17 million procedurally-generated weapons. Each gun is distinct, with crazy stats, hilarious quirks, and unique effects. Weapons are categorized by rarity (white = common, orange = Legendary), and finding that glowing orange drop is like unwrapping a present on Christmas morning.

The loot doesn’t stop at guns. You’ll also find shields, grenades, and class mods to enhance your build. Shields can absorb bullets, deal elemental damage, or explode when broken. Grenades can teleport, split into mini-grenades, or even heal you. The options are endless, and experimenting with gear is half the fun.

The Gun Manufacturers: Who Made This?
The weapons’ personalities come from their manufacturers, each with its own flair and gimmicks:

Jakobs: For sharpshooters who love raw power. Every shot counts—and crits even harder.
Tediore: Why reload when you can throw your gun like a grenade? Genius.
Maliwan: The kings of elemental damage. Burn, zap, or melt your way to victory.
Torgue: EXPLOSIONS. Enough said.
Vladof: For those who believe in fire rates that break physics. Moar bullets!
Bandit: Ugly, clunky, but massive magazines for the spray-and-pray crowd.
Hyperion: Accuracy improves the longer you shoot—ideal for perfectionists.
Dahl: Military-style burst-fire guns for tactical players.
Finding the right combination of weapon stats, effects, and manufacturers keeps every encounter fresh. It’s not just about numbers—it’s about style. Do you want a sniper that explodes on impact? Or a pistol that screams insults when you shoot? The choice is yours.

Meet the Vault Hunters: A Band of Badasses
Your character isn’t just a blank slate—they’re a Vault Hunter with unique abilities and personality. Here’s the roster:

Zer0 (The Assassin): A ninja who loves slicing, dicing, and sniping. His invisibility skill makes him perfect for critical hit builds. Also, he speaks in haikus. Cool, right?

Salvador (The Gunzerker): If “more guns” is your mantra, Salvador is your guy. Dual-wield rocket launchers, laugh maniacally, and watch the chaos unfold.

Maya (The Siren): A master of crowd control. Her Phaselock ability traps enemies mid-air, turning them into helpless loot piñatas.

Axton (The Commando): The tactician. Deploy his turret to draw enemy fire, deal damage, and control the battlefield like a pro.

Gaige (The Mechromancer - DLC): A teenage genius with a killer robot named Deathtrap. If you like chaos and quirky humor, Gaige is your girl.

Krieg (The Psycho - DLC): A literal maniac. Krieg sets himself on fire, charges into battle with a buzz axe, and yells lines like, “I AM THE CONDUCTOR OF THE POOP TRAIN!” Absolute legend.

Each character has unique skill trees that let you customize their playstyle. Whether you’re into stealth, tanking, or pure chaos, there’s a Vault Hunter for you. The variety keeps the game fresh and gives you an excuse to replay (not that you’ll need one).

The Villain: Handsome Jack, The Perfect Jerk
Every great hero needs a great villain, and Handsome Jack is one of the best. He’s smug, sarcastic, and hilariously evil. From mocking your failures to casually threatening genocide, Jack somehow makes you laugh and hate him at the same time. He’s the perfect antagonist and the star of the story—aside from your guns, of course.

The World: Pandora, A Wasteland of Wonders
Pandora isn’t just a backdrop; it’s a character in its own right. The world is dangerous, chaotic, and filled with bizarre characters like Tiny Tina (the bomb-obsessed teenager) and Claptrap (the world's least-helpful robot).

The cel-shaded art style makes Pandora vibrant and timeless, while the humor is woven into every detail. From hilarious enemy names to ridiculous side quests (one involves shooting a guy in the face—because he asked nicely), the game is never short on laughs.

Why You Should Play
Borderlands 2 isn’t just a game—it’s an experience. It’s a love letter to players who want freedom, fun, and a whole lot of loot. Whether you’re farming bosses for Legendaries, building the perfect skill tree, or just laughing at Claptrap’s terrible dance moves, this game has something for everyone.

For new players, it’s a must-play for its humor, fast-paced combat, and incredible loot system. For returning players, it’s a chance to rediscover the joy of blowing up Psychos with Torgue rocket launchers while Handsome Jack calls you a "child-killer."

So grab your guns, pick your Vault Hunter, and prepare for the wildest ride on Pandora. Just don’t trust Claptrap. Ever.

Highly recommended for anyone who loves looter-shooters, RPGs, or laughing until their sides hurt. Welcome back, Vault Hunter. Now get looting.

184844176.review:
my big toe is, unfortunately, has become a moldy, neglected mess, and the condition is not pretty. The skin on the toe is covered in a patchwork of unsightly, discolored spots, ranging from dark greenish-black to a faint, off-yellow hue that looks like it’s been forgotten in a damp, dark corner of a basement. The texture of the skin is rough and uneven, like a neglected, decaying surface. Small, fuzzy patches of mold seem to grow between the thick, hardened skin, especially along the creases where moisture has settled in, unable to escape. The toenail, which should be a healthy, clean pink, is now warped and streaked with the same dark spots, becoming brittle and cracked, as if it’s given up on any hope of ever looking pristine again. Every step i take seems to aggravate the condition, as if the bacteria and fungal growths living on your toe have made themselves right at home, feeding on the damp, unprotected skin.

The smell is another level of disgust entirely. It’s an overpowering, sour stench that hits me the moment i even think about removing my sock. It's a musty, rotten odor — like wet bread that’s been sitting in a dark, warm room for far too long. This unpleasant scent is more than just a minor inconvenience; it lingers in the air around you, creating a cloud of fetidness that refuses to leave. The moisture trapped in your shoe throughout the day has created the perfect environment for mold and bacteria to thrive, and as a result, my toe feels damp to the touch at all times. The constant moisture prevents the skin from drying properly, which only exacerbates the fungal growth and contributes to the unsanitary condition of my foot.

To make matters worse, the skin on my big toe has begun to peel in certain areas, exposing raw, inflamed patches underneath. These patches are prone to irritation and stinging sensations, especially when any sort of pressure or friction is applied. It feels as though the toe is constantly in some kind of battle between trying to heal itself and being overwhelmed by the festering bacteria and fungi. The once-sturdy, protective skin is now soft and prone to infection, and you know that it's only a matter of time before the mold spreads further, likely crawling its way to your other toes or even seeping into my foot. Each time you catch a glimpse of your big toe, it’s a harsh reminder of how a lack of proper care, moisture, and hygiene has led to a fungal nightmare
i can't quite escape.

Так вышло, что я не играл ни в какую часть Борды, кроме BL2, и наверное и не поиграл бы, если бы не поддался на уговоры друзей и знакомых, включая их рассказы о том, какая же это офигенная игра. Меня отталкивала графика, думаю по этой причине некоторые отказываются в неё катать, и.. очень много теряют.

Какая же эта имба, жалею, что не познакомился с ней раньше, не знаю пройду ли самую первую часть, но Бордерлэндс-3 уже купил на зимнем сейле в steam и жду 4 часть, релиз которой намечен на 2025.
Игра представляет собой лутер-шутер, где ты постоянно с кем-то месишься и прокачиваешь себя, меняешь оружие чаще, чем чекаешь соц-сети.

Играл я за ассасина Зеро, самый наиболее близкий мне перс, очень редко правда юзал его способность становиться невидимым на несколько секунд.

В игре провёл около 96 часов, не все сайды ещё выполнил, какие-то квестовые бойни и вовсе завалил, но в эту игру можно возвращаться снова и снова и выбирать себе любого персонажа, какого хочешь и качаться до максимума, я прокачался лвла до 33 вроде, за 50 лвл дают ачивку, и можно и выше качаться.

Принцип тот же, что во многих подобных шут-лутерах - режь, круши, кромсай, лутай, лутай, лутай.

Ещё тут надо стараться не умирать, потому что за это снимают честно найденные и заработанные тобой деньги, но примерно когда половина игры пройдено, денег хватает на всё что хочешь - и на помирать, и прикупить что-то.

Играть можно в коопе до 4 челиков, я в основном играл соло, но немного побегал несколько раз со своей лп, было весело, вообще проходить игру вдвоем/втроём наверное веселее, особенно сложные локации или сложных боссов.
Ещё можно найти бесплатные ключи, тонну ключей и активировать их на сайте, эти ключи дают доступ к Особенному ящику в Убежище, с уникальным фиолетовым оружием, я так заполучил 100 ключей, можно потратить их все, но лучше под конец игры (всего в игре 19 глав) обеспечить себя мощным оружием. Ключи можно найти в инете.

Озвучку я качал отдельно на gamesvoice. Озвучка офигенная, + субтитры. Когда я купил BL2, то вместе с игрой, которая НЕ поддерживает русский язык, установилась ещё и BL2 RU, её НЕ нужно запускать, в неё НЕ нужно играть, только в BL2 eng + установить русификатор с этого сайта, который я выше написал.

Игра меня затянула сразу, я быстро привык к необычной графике, и на деле это оказался офигеннейший имбейший бодрый шутан, от которого я так долго отказывался, дичайше его недооценивая.

Так что всем советую. Скучать там точно не будете.

Если тщательно исследовать локации, то можно найти много интересного, типа уникального оружия, секретиков всяких, такое вот. Особенно обращать внимание на необычные большие ящики, в них всегда интересное оружие.

И вообще лучше гайды чекать по секретам в BL2.

Кст в одном из квестов я нашёл отсылку к Черепашкам-ниндзя, хех. Надо было в канализации убить 4 мутантов, приманив их пиццей хх.

Крч игра имба имба имба, 100000000000/10, думаю я ещё долго в ней бегать буду.

I personally perfer just about every aspect of the original, but gameplay wise this is solid, there are some great classes to play as and it is an exspansive game.

But if you are coming to this from 1, maybe do so being aware that the tone of this (and all future games) is very different, they lost any ability to be subtle and so often beat singular jokes over your head time and time again and the villian (and his many, many reincarnations not just in this game and dlc but in sequels/prequels) is to me one of the singular most overrated villians of all time. He's a worse version of Lucien from Fable 2 (down to how they handle the end even) a game released a couple of years prior to this. Frankly I go into this game for the gameplay alone (which I still maintain takes some missteps from 1, with the gun play and even loot parts system being less robust then its previous entry), thank heavens for the mute button because replaying this would be far too grating otherwise, and even then is a little because there is a bit much of this game, not just the 3 playthoughts or the 10 "OP levels" across 6 characters, but far too much DLC repeating identical quests stories and jokes.

184339778.review:
Well where to begin, lets start with how did this game hold up? For the first 10 hours of the play trough the random HeHexD we're quirky humour was fun and enjoyable, but the more you play on in this game you start to understand the game designers were more interested in the random world that they created then in the quests/story missions/encounters then the game play it self. The story mission scaling is just plain stupid, that's the most good comment that I can say. If you want to complete the game, prepare for random power spikes in the mobs and just just a little bit but lets take the final mission as an example: it's marked as a lvl 28 mission (mind you that you WILL need to do random fetch missions to get to this point after getting to the mission). While you progress in the mission the mobs scale to lvl 32 (the final boss is this level). If you don't know borderlands leveling system at this point (Oh God I envy you). A best level 28 weapon with critical damage (x3) will do around 6k damage and the final boss has around a shit ton of health it doesn't say it but I wasted a full inventory of rockets + sniper rifle bullets and got it to half health. So at this point I think the game designers want me to go back, do random fetch missions and then come back? Do they understand how stupid this is? Did anyone from the Dev team played the full game from start to finish? Did they "frolicked" through the random side quests where you need to kill the same mob 3 times with various styles and thought "huh this is very fun" and if so, do they have terminal brain cancer?

In conclusion, don't waste your time like I did, the jokes are repetitive, you need to grind and I can't emphasize this enough GRIND random side missions to get trough the story, and over all the combat isn't as fun after 20 lvl's.

DO NOT RECOMEND PLAYING THIS HOT GARBAGE, good luck on the next game you choose!

Llevo 25 horas de juego, creo que ni siquiera he llegado a la mitad y tan solo estoy en nivel 25.

No había jugado tanto en "rush" desde hace años. Es un shooter magnífico, el gunplay te va a enamorar, y si lo tuyo es hacer builds complejas y sobrepensar cada punto del juego para romperlo, también hay un espacio para ti.

Cabe mencionar que no jugué BL1 y no siento que me esté perdiendo de mucho en la historia. Hablando de ella, es una joya: te encariñas con los personajes, amas/odias a los correspondientes y su humor... Dios santísimo, el humor de este juego es precioso.

Escribo todo esto con la emoción de jugarlo actualmente. Repito, llevo 25 horas y pienso rejugar con otro personaje. Me convenció lo suficiente para comprar BL: The Pre-Sequel y no dudaré en jugarlo.

Lo recomiendo infinitamente y más su versión GOTY. Cómpralo en rebaja para aprovechar aún más, y no te preocupes por los requerimientos de hardware, es sencillo de correr.

Pienso actualizar la reseña una vez lo termine.

[i]NOTA[/i]: Es un goce para los que hayan jugado Destiny, un looter shooter de cuidado.

184164468.review:
Good sequel, but "2" fans should just play Dark Souls 2 instead.

Borderlands 2 stands out as the best entry in the Borderlands series, However, if you consider yourself a fan of sequels and are looking for something far deeper and more rewarding, Dark Souls 2 is without a doubt the best sequel ever made. While Borderlands 2 builds upon its predecessor with greater humor and loot mechanics, Dark Souls 2 takes everything that made the first Dark Souls great and refines it to perfection. The combat is more fluid, the world-building is even more intricate, and the game is filled with more areas to explore, more bosses to conquer, and more secrets to uncover. The difficulty is heightened, the stakes are higher, and every victory feels that much more earned. The sense of progression is unlike anything in Borderlands 2, offering a methodical and challenging journey that rewards both strategy and skill. Dark Souls 2 took what was already a brilliant formula and expanded it, making it not only the best sequel in the Dark Souls series but one of the greatest games of all time.

Why You Should Play Dark Souls 2 Instead

If you’re a "2" fan, the choice is clear: Dark Souls 2 should be your next adventure. While Borderlands 2 is an exceptional game filled with fun, humor, and hours of loot-driven excitement, it cannot compare to the depth, challenge, and lasting impact of Dark Souls 2. Borderlands 2 offers immediate fun, but Dark Souls 2 provides a much richer, more satisfying experience that stays with you long after the credits roll. The meticulous world design, atmospheric storytelling, and complex combat mechanics make it a truly unparalleled experience. If you're looking for a sequel that takes everything from its predecessor and pushes it to new heights, Dark Souls 2 is the game you should dive into, as it will challenge, inspire, and reward you in ways that Borderlands 2 simply can't.

184099337.review:
Alright, listen up, vault hunters: this game is bananas. Borderlands 2 is basically what happens when a first-person shooter and an RPG get smashed together at a rave, and then someone throws in a truckload of guns and a psycho yelling, "MEAT BICYCLE!"

First off, the story is chef’s kiss. Handsome Jack is one of the best villains ever—he’s hilarious, smug, and you’ll love to hate him while he’s roasting you mid-mission. The humor in this game is top-tier. Claptrap’s still out here being an annoying little toaster, and the NPCs? Pure comedy gold. I’m looking at you, Tiny Tina. Explosions + tea parties = iconic.

But let’s talk gameplay. The gun variety is insane. You’ve got guns that shoot fire, guns that explode, and even guns that insult you. Found one that screamed at me while reloading, and honestly, I felt judged—but it was worth it. The skill trees for each class are super customizable too. Wanna be an invisible sniper ninja? Done. Prefer a turret that does all the killing while you watch? Easy.

Oh, and co-op? Absolute chaos. Solo’s great too, but trust me, this game shines when you’re yelling at your friends because they stole your legendary loot drop.

The visuals still slap, even years later. That comic-book style? Timeless. And the music? Gets your blood pumping while you’re mowing down bandits or taking on a massive raid boss.

TL;DR: If you like ridiculous fun, crazy guns, and jokes so dumb they’re genius, Borderlands 2 is THE game. Just get it. You can thank me later. (And don’t trust Claptrap, seriously.)

10/10 – Would loot and shoot again.

184080396.review:
What a game this one is.

I remember the hype in 2012 for this title, I remember seeing Simon from the Yogscast receive an Xbox 360-version chest full of goodies for this game. I remember watching the Yogscast play this title. I didn't have a PC or console that could have played the game, but I felt its impact at the time through YouTube.

A couple years later I would end up grabbing a PS3, and as a family gift, I received a pack of Dishonred and Borderlands 2 together. I ended up (after much indecision) deciding to play Borderlands 2 over Dishonored, and I ended up playing it FOR HOURS. I didn't have any expansions or GOTY editions or anything like that.

I ended up spending days playing through the story and side missions. It's gunplay is impeccable. Handsome Jack is still funny and understandable in a perfectly blended fashion all these years later. The randomization added a level of competition and hope to each loot box you opened. The side missions were great and funny. The grind was rewarding. I could talk on and on about how great this game is. Ironically, I ended up having a science fair trip that I had to go to in high school that interrupted my daily play time, and all I could think about during that trip was when I could play Borderlands 2 again. 

I was hooked, and I still fondly remember the time I played this game for, there was nothing like it, I wish I could go back and play this game again for the first time blind. 

Fun fact, the PS3 version is significantly graphically hindered compared to the PC and Xbox 360 versions at release, and definitely behind all the remastered and re-released copies now. I had no idea about this fact, and thought some of the weird graphical oddities were actually artistic or creative choices. The game later released on NVIDIA Shield and PS VITA, both of which had even further hindered visuals to the PS3 game, which I thought were the "hindered versions", oh how naive I was.

Some time a while later, I found Borderlands 2 GOTY on sale on Steam for super cheap, I decided to give it a purchase, and to buy a copy for a friend. We ended up getting through a decent chunk of BL2's campaign in co-op mode, something I never tried on the PS3. By itself, the co-op campaign feature is fully worth its full value. 

Very few games do that, and it really adds a level of connection to this title as it makes it an experience with close friends that is memorable. The GOTY's DLC additions add a lot of fantastic content and class types that even broaden further the variety and replayability of this title. I ended up redoing the campaign again solo with the Mechronancer class on PC which was only available via DLC. 

I do recommend playing this title in it's GOTY method rather than stock, there is so much added on that gives this game so much more depth than what is already provided, you are missing out if you don't.

This game is 100% worth the time, playing it blind is truly an experience that you will never forget, you will feel glad you did. Even better, this game goes on sale for most sales on Steam, so it is completely possible to snag this absolute gem for an excellent price and get the incredible experience that I and many others rave about and not have to break the bank for it.

184008345.review:
Du fun, des armes, des conneries, du cell shading, de la folie, des explosions, des voitures, des boss.
A consommer en solo ou en co-opération :ok:

Plus sérieusement, le style graphique est superbement maitrisé (mais il faut y adhérer), les effets de lumière et de liquide sont très bien faits. Les environnement sont relativement nombreux.

Le gameplay est classique, tout en étant vivifier par un petit aspect rpg (Arbre de talent, point de compétence) et des défis qui ont une utilité (Remplir des défis augmente les points de brutasse, ceux ci permettent de gagner des jetons qui, utilisé, augmenter un pourcentage d'une caractéristique choisi par le joueur).
Beaucoup d'arme, pour tout les styles, des personnages attachant et plutôt drôles. Un système d'élément (Elecritcité, feu, corosion, explosion et slag) bien pensé, et utile.

Une bande son aux petites oignons, avec une vf tout simplement superbe ), les musiques sont bonnes, collent bien a l'action.

Scénaristiquement, cela pourrait être "mieux" mais il y a tout de même quelques petits rebondissement plutôt bien amené.

Et enfin, la durée de vie.
Tout simplement énorme, le jeu est un goufre a temps. Vous aurez envie de refaire certains boss pour trouver de meilleurs objets a récuperer, pas mal de quête secondaire qui ne sont pas de simple quête Fedex comme on en voit dans pas mal de Rpg (et qui plus est, avec de grosse touche d'humour et de clin d'oeil a d'autres jeux).
La quête principal étant tout de même assez longue elle aussi.

Bref, rien ne peut et ne doit vous retenir dans votre achat, ce jeu est une petite bombe a apprecier avec modération (ou non en faite).

Para realizar o exame, o paciente: 
Deita-se numa maca que desliza para dentro do aparelho
Deve permanecer imóvel durante todo o exame
Pode ser necessário retirar objetos metálicos, como brincos, colares, piercings e pulseiras
Pode ser necessário fazer uso de uma medicação de contraste
O exame pode durar de 20 a 90 minutos, dependendo da parte do corpo a ser analisada. 
O procedimento é realizado da seguinte forma: 
O paciente deita-se dentro da máquina 
O campo magnético realinha as moléculas de água do corpo 
As ondas de rádio produzem sinais fracos que são usados para criar imagens 
O profissional pode aplicar contraste para melhorar a visualização da área em avaliação 
A máquina produz barulho alto, por isso, é disponibilizado protetores de ouvido.

183597433.review:
Borderlands 2 is a chaotic and highly entertaining blend of first-person shooting and RPG elements. The game’s vibrant, cel-shaded world is filled with quirky characters, hilarious dialogue, and an array of crazy weapons. Each of the four playable characters has unique abilities, allowing for diverse playstyles and replayability, whether you're going solo or teaming up with friends in co-op mode.

The loot system is one of the game’s highlights, with countless guns to discover, each with their own distinct stats and abilities. The humor and over-the-top action keep the gameplay engaging, even when the mission structure feels somewhat repetitive.

Overall, Borderlands 2 is an action-packed, fun-filled ride with great cooperative gameplay and a ton of loot to discover. If you enjoy a mix of fast-paced shooting, humor, and RPG mechanics, this game is definitely worth playing.
